title: Government to reportedly shutter Green Homes Grant after less than a year
lead: ​The Green Homes Grant is to reportedly be scrapped next month following less than a year of operation.
author: Alice Grundy

title: British Gas announced as final Electric Nation energy partner
lead: ​British Gas has become the latest supplier to join Western Power Distribution's (WPD) vehicle-to-grid (V2G) trial, Electric Nation.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ENA unveils ‘ground-breaking’ in-depth digital system map to support decarbonisation pathway
lead: ​Energy Networks Association (ENA) is developing an in-depth digital system map of the UK’s energy system to support a pathway to net zero.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ROUND-UP: Zap-Map and Bulb expand senior leadership teams
lead: Zap-Map announces a new interim CEO and commercial director, while Bulb appoints a new VP Experience.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: LowCVP backs zero emission transport goals with rebrand to Zemo Partnership
lead: LowCVP has rebranded as the Zemo Partnership to reflect the need for UK road transport emissions to fall to zero by 2050.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EDF records 'solid' financial results as renewables generation remains strong
lead: ​EDF has recorded what it has described as "solid" financial results as its renewable generation has soared by 6.3%.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Limejump hails ‘terrific response’ in power market as it adds 170MW already in 2021
lead: ​Limejump has added more than 200 renewable generators to its Virtual Power Plant (VPP) through Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) in 2021.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSEN secures 384MW of flexibility contracts
lead: ​Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) has secured 348MW of flexibility contracts across five sites in Scotland and two in central and southern England.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EV chargers deployed as part of EV100 commitments surge by 79%
lead: ​Nearly 16,900 electric vehicle (EV) chargepoints have been installed for companies signed up to The Climate Group’s EV100 initiative.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Alfen continues strong EV charging growth with 105% increase in 2020 revenues
lead: ​Alfen has posted its FY 2020 results, with its electric vehicle (EV) charging business continuing to see a significant increase as revenues jump 105%.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Utilities call for gas' ‘thumb to be taken off the scale’ with changes to levies
lead: Utilities have called for changes to "outdated" gas and electricity levies in a bid to decrease costs of electrified heating and save the poorest households more than £100 a year.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ESO readies for low summer demand with new Optional Downward Flexibility Management consultation
lead: ​The Optional Downward Flexibility Management (ODFM) service is to be reinstated this summer, with National Grid ESO now consulting on its terms and conditions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Brexit has reduced trading with Ireland sending power prices ‘rocketing’
lead: ​Brexit has led to reduced trading over Irish electricity interconnectors and increased the frequency of extreme prices .
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Wind generation hits new peak amidst Beast from the East 2
lead: ​Wind generation has smashed yet another record, hitting a new generation high of 17.5GW this weekend.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: PODCAST: The changing shape of energy flexibility, solar and energy storage enter new phases
lead: The latest episode of the Solar Media Podcast is now available stream, exploring how energy flexibility is changing in the UK and beyond.
author: Current± Staff

title: Elexon calls for ‘holistic reform’ of system operator roles and code arrangements
lead: ​Elexon has thrown its weight behind a reorganisation of both the system operator (SO) roles and code arrangements to develop a ‘holistic’ system that can support net zero.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Centrica unveils plans to install 78 heat pumps in council partnership
lead: ​Centrica is to install heat pumps and other low carbon technology at 78 homes in East Devon over the next month.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Octopus partners NatWest for EV charger finance solution
lead: ​Octopus Energy has partnered NatWest to offer electric vehicle (EV) charger financing to all of the latter’s personal, business and wealth customers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: BP joins IBM Quantum Network to advance quantum computing in energy sector
lead: ​BP has joined the IBM Quantum Network as an Industry Partner to access quantum expertise, software and cloud-based access to the most advanced quantum computers.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Britain ‘edges closer to the power system of the future’ as 2020 is hailed as greenest year
lead: ​Last year was Britain’s greenest yet, with renewables generating more power than fossil fuels for the first time according to a new report from Drax Electric Insights.
author: Molly Lempriere
